Events

Politics and World Affairs

Africa

Europe

America

October 20: The Treaty of Ancon ends the Salpeter between Chile and Peru.

Chile subjecting the Mapuche and injects a territory of the country.

Economy

Money economy

Patents

May 8: Moritz Honigmann receives a patent for the fire loose Natronlokomotive.

September 4: The inventor Emil Berliner receives in the United States a patent on a type of parquet design.

Business start-ups

Traffic

APRIL 27: The Altona- Kaltenkirchener Railway Company receives the royal concession establishing.

June 5: The first Orient Express departs from Paris Ostbahnhof to drive to Varna on the Black Sea, where travelers can take a ship to Constantinople Opel.

4 October: The official inauguration journey of the Orient Express - after the first Zugstart on June 5 - begins in Paris's Gare de l' Est train station. The initiating Belgian entrepreneur Georges travel Nagelmackers has also invited journalists. As a result, his company benefited Compagnie Internationale des Wagons- Lits, the sleeping and dining car operates, reports on the trip.

Others

April 5: From the Court established for the settlement of domestic and transnational conflicts within London grows with the time of the global difference Court London Court of International Arbitration.

The first Swiss National Exhibition is held in Zurich.

Science and Technology

Astronomy

August 30: Edward Barnard discovered, known as NGC 1255 galaxy in the constellation Chemical oven.

October 2: Édouard Jean -Marie Stephan found in the constellation Pegasus galaxy NGC 22

October 4: Édouard Jean -Marie Stephan noticed the cataloged as NGC 149 galaxy in the constellation Andromeda.

October 6: Édouard Jean -Marie Stephan discovered in the constellation Andromeda galaxies later so designated NGC 181, NGC 183 and NGC 184

October 8 Édouard Jean -Marie Stephan feels the constellation Cetus on the galaxy NGC 62.

Criminology and Medicine

February 20: Alphonse Bertillon achieved with the help of a developed system he identification of an offender due to the body dimensions of what has become a relapse.

Robert Koch isolated together with Georg Fischer and Gaffky the cholera pathogen from the gut of deceased patients.

Other scientific and technical events

MAY 24: Opening of the Brooklyn Bridge, then East River Bridge, between Manhattan and Brooklyn

At the Technical University of Darmstadt the world's first degree program in electrical engineering is established.

Culture
